UYRUFC recorded their first win in the BUCS Premier League today with an incredible 33-15 victory over Loughborough in an historic afternoon for the club

A depleted women's basketball side were put to the sword by an impressive Durham seconds outfit this afternoon

York student set to represent Jamaican rugby side

A student from the University of York is flying out to the Cayman Islands to play for Jamaica in a major international rugby tournament.

Langwith collapse hands Wentworth huge win

Wentworth took advantage of a second half Langwith collapse to recover from last week's defeat to Vanbrugh with six goals.

Derwent seal hard fought victory over Halifax

Fresh from their trouncing over Alcuin last week, a confident Derwent side stepped out onto 22 Acres faced with a tougher challenge, Halifax - the side they lost to in the College Cup final last season.

James run away with huge win against league-leaders Goodricke

The game was billed to be a classic when the league's undefeated top two sides took to a blustery 22 Acres, but it was the more organised James side that ran away with a huge win this afternoon.

Vanbrugh fought off a spirited second-half comeback from Alcuin on Sunday to win for the second weekend in succession.

By James Bithell

As the 2013 Rugby League World Cup gets underway this weekend, Robert Culshaw delivers his verdict on the England team's options at the back

Strong Sheffield Hallam side beat back disappointed York

York women's firsts suffered a disappointing 4-2 loss despite a late comeback against Sheffield Hallam firsts on a cold, flood-lit JLD.

Men's lacrosse firsts enjoy emphatic success away at Durham

The men's firsts lacrosse team continued their scintillating form with an away win at Durham this week, powering home 39 goals against the hapless Durham thirds.

Basketball women's firsts breeze past Sunderland

York's basketball women's firsts eased to an impressive victory against a Sunderland side that struggled to cope with the pace and counter-attacking prowess of their opponents

Men's hockey firsts held in tight match

York men's hockey firsts conceded an agonisingly late equaliser as they were held 1-1 by Northumbria firsts this afternoon on an overcast JLD

Men's basketball seal victory in Newcastle thriller

York's men's basketball firsts recorded their first win of the season, in a nail-biting encounter against Newcastle seconds

Disappointing defeat for women's volleyball seconds

A young women's volleyball second team, two thirds of which is made up from first years, slumped to a disappointing 3-1 home loss at the hands of a clinical Durham team.

Lacklustre Leeds no match for UYWAFC

The score-line would suggest that the match was somewhat of a close encounter, but it was all one-way traffic as York's women's firsts football side brushed aside Leeds with ease on 22 Acres.

Women's squash team thump dire Northumbria

The women's firsts put on an incredible display of virtuoso squash to thrash Northumbria 3-0 this afternoon in under an hour

Men's rowers impress at British Championships

The University of York Boat Club Men's squad competed in their first race of the season at the British Championships last weekend, finishing ninth overall

Swimmers off to promising start

The University of York Swimming and Water Polo Club opened the season with a friendly gala at the York Sport Village on Saturday evening

In his second 'Faith in Sport' piece, George Barrett talks to test cricket legend Henry Olonga about his beliefs, his career, and standing up against Robert Mugabe

Bringing a marathon to York is brilliant, something every city deserves to experience, and I would encourage every student here to get out and enjoy it while you have the opportunity

There was late drama in both of this weekend's headline college netball games

College sport officers Dave Washington and Tom Merriman have announced a new sponsorship deal with York Parties to increase the financial position of college sport

Vanbrugh coast past postgrads

Vanbrugh eased past a notably lethargic Wentworth side on Sunday at 22 Acres, with a brace from Elliot Rous-Ross and a fine solo effort from Clemens Blasius sealing a deserved 3-0 victory

Four-goal James hold off spirited Halifax side

James saw off a valiant second half comeback from College Cup holders Halifax to bag their second win of the autumn season on Sunday

Goodricke take victory in Hes East Derby

In a game interrupted by helicopters, pitch changes and injuries, Goodricke came out as the clear victors after thrashing their campus rivals with a seven-goal deficit on a sun-drenched 22 Acres

Derwent bounced back from their surprise defeat to Goodricke on Matchday One with the emphatic double-digit destruction of a slightly depleted Alcuin, 10-0
